title: Comparative Design of Clinical Practice Curricula Based on the 4C/ID Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and understanding of foundational instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: A simulation/VR environment where pre-service/in-service teachers comparatively analyze clinical practicum curricula and apply the four components of the 4C/ID model (learning objectives, learning tasks, supportive information, learning environment)

learning_goals: They can apply the core components of the 4C/ID model to clinical practice education curricula.
They can analyze differences between domestic and international clinical practice education programs using the 4C/ID framework.
They can design collaborative learning scenarios in real clinical environments using VR simulations.

resources: Domestic/International Clinical Practice Educational Materials Database

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
